ticketSummary.problem: The login button on mobile devices is not responding to touch events, preventing users from accessing their accounts.
ticketSummary.solution: Fix the CSS touch-action properties and JavaScript event handlers to ensure the login button responds to touch events on all mobile devices.
ticketSummary.context: This issue affects the authentication process on mobile devices, impacting user access and satisfaction. It is critical to resolve this to maintain user engagement and trust.

acceptanceCriteria.title: Login Button Touch Response
acceptanceCriteria.description: The login button must respond to touch events on all mobile devices, including iOS Safari and Android Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria.title: Consistent User Experience
acceptanceCriteria.description: The login button should provide a consistent user experience across all mobile devices, ensuring it appears clickable and triggers the login process.

acceptanceCriteria.title: UI Feedback on Touch
acceptanceCriteria.description: The login button should provide visual feedback when touched, indicating that the touch event has been registered.

acceptanceCriteria.title: Accessibility Compliance
acceptanceCriteria.description: The login button must be accessible, supporting screen readers and other assistive technologies on mobile devices.

testCase.scenario: Login button responds to touch on mobile devices
given: a mobile device with iOS Safari or Android Chrome
when: the user touches the login button
then: the login process is triggered successfully

testCase.scenario: Consistent user experience across mobile devices
given: a mobile device with iOS Safari or Android Chrome
when: the user views the login button
then: the button appears clickable and provides feedback when touched

testCase.scenario: UI feedback on login button touch
given: a mobile device with iOS Safari or Android Chrome
when: the user touches the login button
then: the button provides visual feedback indicating the touch event

given: a mobile device with screen reader enabled
when: the user navigates to the login button
then: the button is announced correctly and can be activated via assistive technology
